approval_instructions.text: Please check all of the checkbox below
action: I have checked all of the data correctly
I approve this data for submission

questions.question: Name of the data collector (Enumerator)
Organisation
Take the GPS location
Location
Is the school in an urban, peri-urban or rural setup?
questions.name: Whether Urban, Peri Urban or Rural

questions.question: School name
School ministry of education code
School level
Is the school Public or private?
What is the school category?
Number of boys
questions.name: # of boys

questions.question: Number of girls
questions.name: # of girls

questions.question: Number of male staff
questions.name: # of male staff

questions.question: Number of female staff
questions.name: # of female staff

questions.question: Is drinking water available in the school?
What is the main source of drinking water in the school?
questions.name: Main source of drinking water

questions.question: If unimproved, Why does school use water from unimproved water source?
questions.name: Main source of drinking water

options.name: Improved water source is too far
Improved water source is salty/hard water
Improved water source has system failure
Expensive water tariff from improved water sources
Long queue at improved water source
Limited working days for improved water source
Limited working hours for improved water source
Improved water source regularly not opened
Unimproved water source is assumed as clean

questions.question: If no, Where does the school get drinking from?
Is drinking water from the main source currently available at the school?
questions.name: Drinking water from main source is available

questions.question: Is drinking water from the main source typically available throughout the school year?
questions.name: Drinking water is available throughout the schooll year

questions.question: What is the main reason for drinking water not being available at the school?
questions.name: Reason why drinking water is not available

options.name: The water is not easily accessible for students
Students are not allowed to drink water in the school

questions.question: Is drinking water accessible to those with limited mobility or vision?
questions.name: Drinking water accessible for students with limited mobility or vision impaired

questions.question: Is drinking water accessible to the smallest children at the school?
questions.name: Drinking water accessible for smallest children at the school

questions.question: How many drinking water points (e.g. taps) are at the school?
questions.name: # of drinking water points

questions.question: Does the school treat drinking water?
questions.name: School do something to make it safe to drink

questions.question: If yes, what treatment method is used?
questions.name: Water treatment method

questions.question: In your opinion, what are the benefits of having water in the school?
questions.name: Advantages of providing water in school

options.name: Students don't miss class for searching drinking water
School girls can use the water washing during their menstruation
Students can use the water for anal wash
The water can be used for cleaning the toilet

questions.question: Does the school have sanitation facilities?
What type of student toilets/ latrines are at the school? (check one - most common)
questions.name: Types of latrines for students

questions.question: Are there gender separated toilets?
questions.name: Gender-separated toilets

questions.question: How many girls only toilets available?
How many girls only toilets are in use?
questions.name: # of girls toilets

questions.question: How many boys only toilets available?
questions.name: # of boys toilets

questions.question: How many boys only toilets are in use?
questions.name: # of boys toilets in use

questions.question: How many common use toilets available?
questions.name: # common use of toilets

questions.question: How many common use toilets IN USE?
questions.name: # common use of toilets in use

questions.question: Do boys and girls have problems using the common latrine, and why?
questions.name: Problems using the common laterine

options.name: Girls don't feel comfortable to use common latrine
Boys don't feel comfortable to use common latrine
Girls' latrine is different from boys' latrine
Boys tease girls when they see them in/around latrine

questions.question: When are students permitted to use the school latrines?
questions.name: Students permitted to use the school laterines

options.name: At all times during the school day
At specific times during the school day (e.g. break time etc.)
Only, when they get permission from the teachers

questions.question: Are the latrines being used?
questions.name: Laterines are being used

questions.question: If the latrines/toilets are not used, what is/are the reason/s?
questions.name: Reason to not use laterine / toilets

options.name: I don't use the school latrines because they are always locked
I don't use the school latrines because they not clean option
I don't use the school latrines because they have bad smell
I don't use the school latrines because they do not have doors/lockers
I don't use the school latrines because they are not sufficient
I don't use school latrines because they are not safe for use

questions.question: What do you think are the advantage of having latrines in the school?
questions.name: The advantage of having laterines

options.name: Helps to prevent spread of disease

questions.question: Do the student/s facing any challenge due to lack of latrine?
questions.name: Any challenge due to lack of laterine

questions.question: What is the challenge they face?
questions.name: The challenge due to lack of laterine

options.name: Students missed class to go home for defecation or urine
Students lose concentration on their lessons in the class
Students have to go far to seek a private placeNew option
Students become sick in the class

questions.question: Are there dust bins in the school latrines?
questions.name: Dust bins in the school latereines

questions.question: Can boys and girls use common latrines?
questions.name: Boys and girls use common laterines

questions.question: Why can't boys and girls use the common latrine?
questions.name: Reason not using the common laterine

options.name: Girls don't feel comfortable to use common latrine
Boys don't feel comfortable to use common latrine
Girls' latrine is different from boys' latrine
Boys tease girls when they see them in/around latrine

questions.question: How frequent are toilets cleaned?
questions.name: Toilet cleaned / week

questions.question: In general, how clean are the student toilets?
questions.name: The student toilets is clean

questions.question: Is there at least one usable toilet/latrine that is accessible to the smallest children at the school?
questions.name: The student toilets is clean

questions.question: Is there at least one usable toilet/latrine that is adapted for learners with special needs and disabilities?
questions.name: Toilet / laterine is accessible limited mobility or vision

questions.question: If no, where do they go for short and long calls?
Are appropriate anal cleansing materials available to all students?
questions.name: Appropriate anal cleansing materials is available

questions.question: Is there currently functional lighting in the student toilets?
questions.name: Functional lighting in the students toilets

questions.question: Are latrines or septic tanks emptied (or latrines safely covered) when they fill up?
questions.name: Functional lighting in the students toilets

questions.question: If Yes, How are they emptied?
Are there handwashing facilities at the school?
questions.name: Handwashing facilities is available

questions.question: Are both soap and water currently available at the handwashing facilities?
questions.name: Soap and water are available

questions.question: Where are handwashing facilities with water and soap located at the school? (mark all that apply)
questions.name: Handwashing facilities location

questions.question: How many handwashing facilities with water and soap are located at the school?
questions.name: # of handwashing facilities with water and soap

questions.question: Do pupils wash their hands in the school?
questions.name: Pupils wash their hands in the school

questions.question: How do they usually wash their hands in the school?
questions.name: How to wash their hands in the school

questions.question: When do you think is the critical hand washing time when at home or at school?

options.name: After I wake up from my sleep
After I play sport on school ground

questions.question: Are there hand washing facilities accessible to learners with special needs and disabilities?
questions.name: Handwashing facilities is accessible for limited mobility or vision

questions.question: Are there handwashing facilities accessible to the smallest children at the school?
questions.name: Handwashing facilities is accessible to the smallest children

questions.question: Have girls been educated on what to expect during their first period?
What facilities have been provided for girls to manage their menses hygienically and without being embarrassed while in school?
questions.name: Private facility for girls during menstrual period

questions.question: What menstrual hygiene materials are provided to the girls during menstruation while at school?
Which challenges do girls during their menstruation while in school?
questions.name: Challenges during their menstruation time

options.name: There is no private place (latrine) for changing used sanitary pads or cloth
Lack of water to wash their body
There is no soap for washing their body
There is no safe disposal system for used materials
Boys tease girls when they see lick of blood or solid cloth

questions.question: Do girls miss any activities because of menstruation?
questions.name: Missing activities during menstruation

questions.question: Are there covered bins for disposal of menstrual hygiene materials in girls' toilets?
questions.name: Covered bins in girls toilets

questions.question: If No, where do they dispose off?
Are there disposal mechanisms for menstrual hygiene waste at the school?
questions.name: Disposal mechanism

questions.question: Are water and soap available in a private space for girls to manage menstrual hygiene?
questions.name: Water and soap are available in a girls private space

questions.question: You can use any place to excrete as long as people don't see you.
questions.name: Place to excrete

questions.question: My school tolerates open defecation
questions.name: Tolerates open defecation

questions.question: How often is the school compound swept/cleaned?
questions.name: Compound swept / cleaned

options.name: Three to six times a week

questions.question: Are there garbage or waste materials that are currently affecting the sanitation of the school?
questions.name: Waste materials affecting the sanitation

questions.question: How are the garbage/waste materials affecting the school sanitation?
questions.name: The effect of the waste

options.name: The waste is dispersed by wind
The liquid waste creates bad smell

questions.question: How does the school dispose off garbage or waste materials safely and hygienically?
questions.name: How it should be disposed

options.name: Buried in a pit within school compound
Burned in a pit within school compound
Thrown in school compound without burying /burning

questions.question: In your opinion, what should the school do to promote good hygiene and sanitation of students?
questions.name: Opinion on how to promote good hygiene and sanitation

options.name: Make cleaning materials (broom , mop etc.) ready
Provide sanitation and hygiene education to students

questions.question: Are cleaning protocols available?
questions.name: Cleaning protocols is available

questions.question: Have all the staff responsible for cleaning been trained on the training protocol?
questions.name: Cleaning staff is trained

options.name: No, some but not all have been trained
No, there are no staff responsible for cleaning

questions.question: Any general comments / concerns during the data collection?
questions.name: General comments
